required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Target Gene Sequencing for Advanced Stage, Relapsed or Refractory Natural Killer/T-cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: Target Gene Sequencing for Advanced Stage, Relapsed/Refractory Natural Killer/T-cell Lymphoma and the Correlation Between Gene Abmormalities and Chemotherapy Efficacy

brief_summary.textblock: Although modern radiation techniques combined with chemotherapy has greatly improved the local control and long-term survivals for patients with early-stage NKTCL, relapse and systemic dissemination are common for localized patients. Relapsed/refractory diseases together with advanced stage NKTCLs uaually progress rapidly with poor prognosis (5-year overall survival rate, 0-20%). According to published studies, some recurrent genetic alternations have been identified in NKTCL, including oncogene/tumor suppressive gene abberants, epigenetic changes, cellular signaling pathways abnormalities, cellular apoptosis related genes and so forth. However, the gene profiling techniques and materials vary in different studies, no consensus has been reached on the gene abnormalities of advanced, or relapsed/refractory NKTCL up to now. Additionally, gene sequencing using ctDNA of peripheral blood has been unexploited in NKTCL patients.

primary_outcome.description: The concordance of plasma cfDNA genotyping and tumor genotyping is defined as the ratio of gene variants detected in tumor and cfDNA to variants identified in tumor

study_pop.textblock: We plan to recurit 30 eligile patients who are diagnosed in our hospital.
